its funny {{champion:6}} is always good i dont why he was never played until now the LCS plays them and everybody like omg no way im doing urgot mid or adc 

Idk thats just me saying here sooo.. dont matter...{{summoner:31}}

Bro i feel the same way! Everyone's like "Urgot worst champion lol" or "report mid laner for trolling. they picked urgot". Now that people in the LCS are playing him people are like URGOT OP! OMG he is finally amazing! OMG! It's fucking annoying. I've always loved playing urgot and wrecking. I also love Galio.

I'm with you... my friend gots pentas with Mordekaiser jungle, and he still gets flamed no matter what he tells people. I think it means very little to pay attention to the meta unless you're in gold+, and even then it's not 100% required to be successful.
meta just tells you which champions are currently stronger than others. however, this does not mean you cant carry on your best champions if they are not meta. people should understand that

Are you seriously referencing Nazi Germany and the Holocaust to the "current meta" mindset of solo queue?

There are no words....

Another similar thing that a friend of mine played well over a year ago, soon after he started, was {{champion:111}}  support. Everyone just thought he was dumb, and now, over a year later, they now realize how much cc he has, and how strong me and him knew the pick was.

It's not so much that "LCS plays it, now I gotta play it." They both got pretty good buffs and that opens up their viability. Plus with the way the meta is, they are both good counters or fit right in. As in, team fights > laning phase.
no. 100% of it is the LCS. The LCS realizes how meta changes, and they realize the potential, not the 90% stupid playerbase

This is why I have animosity towards the meta. Everyone will curse you out for trying new things that have the potential of working, and it takes only one pro player to prove it and everyone finds it okay.
Just because you see Bjergsen using Urgot doesn't mean the scrub in solo queue has any idea what he's doing with that champ, nor does it make Urgot viable in any given match.

Just because you see Bjergsen or any other pro on a specific champion, doesn't mean they're the best on the said champion. There are thousands of people who practiced some champions over course of hundreds of games and even though their ranking is lower than that of pros, they might actually be better than pros on those champions. The difference between pros and the rest of the people is not necesarily mechanical prowess, other factors come into play.

First off.  Just because a pro can do it does not mean that I condone the use of some anti-meta champs for scrubs to use.

That being said, I give a pick quite a bit of consideration before I decide to dodge because of it.  I play out fights in my head and weigh the validity of the champion before I cast judgement.

I am an anti-meta player myself at times.  Brand support, Malz Jungle, Leona Jungle, Galio Support, etc..

No! Please no.. I really don't want someone to go urgot mid in ranked... Now, people with no experience on urgot will get in ranked and feed, thinking that he will be so "op"... {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}
That's kind of why you don't suddenly play him in ranked, you get good at him first
one does not simply get matched with people who know what they're doing

I am at silver so it's just gonna get messier here..  People in silver tend to ban/play what pros play in lcs or whatever the champ is op that week. So they will be playing urgot like crazy in ranked.. #Thanksbjergerking
5 ranked game since this post, (2 games are my roommate's) they all had urgot... and they were  doing bad..

I think you sir, are an absolute moron.

It is truly sad that no body in this day and age can think for them self...... they rely on these so called "pros" to tell them what the current "meta" is, and riot listens not to the average player, but to only the "pros" when they are 'fixing' or 'destroying' a current champion that honestly had no problems to begin with, the reason a ton of people don't play urgot, is because they don't know how, people are too stubborn to learn, until their 'peers' being the "pros" say it's okay... seriously people??? Stop living as sheep and start thinking for yourself, and over all, PLAY TO HAVE FUN.

So sadly true, most people only try things that pros or the meta says. NEWSFLASH the pros make it work because they are pros. Try something new and if you like how it "feels", keep playing until you make it "work",and congrats you're original and broke the meta!!!
They aren't so called "pros"... they are literally professionals, they are paid to play League of Legends competitively, making them pros, not "pros".

you name yourself after weed and you say people must stop being sheep? i say stop being a hypocrite and have some respect for players who get played to play LoL (which makes them legit pro's at it like any other sport or profession as tooitchy said). Have you spent the last 3-5 years playing LoL for the majority of the day everyday? If you have why aren't you on the pro scene? and thats the reason why Riot talk to the pro's about the meta and champs and not you.
I say to you continue smoking your weed and thinking you aren't one of the sheep I'm sure it will please you to no end, just don't be stupid and disrespectful to others you pleb.

I actually have been playing since early season 2, so that's 3-4 years, i get paid to play, but not by riot, i stream, but i don't consider myself professional, i guess in some sense of the term i am.... but i don't play as a sport, i play for fun, my followers love my attitude and my humor... there isn't a thing i'd change about my league career! :) and what does smoking weed have to do with anything, you ignorant prick, i can literally pick up any champion, and bring them any lane, and be comfortable in a ranked setting, it has nothing to do with Meta, it has to do with you knowing game mechanics and champion mechanics and enemy champion mechanics, if you can't play a champion well in a certain lane, that's on you, not the game.. just saying, that is the point i was trying to make lol

I actually have been playing since early season 2, so that's 3-4 years, i get paid to play, but not by riot, i stream, but i don't consider myself professional, i guess in some sense of the term i am.... but i don't play as a sport, i play for fun, my followers love my attitude and my humor... there isn't a thing i'd change about my league career! :) and what does smoking weed have to do with anything, you ignorant prick
Why is Urgot now in the meta?!?!? I hate Urgot with a passion >:( {{champion:6}} {{summoner:11}} {{champion:113}}
Urgot has always been good, just people have always thought he was bad until recently... They didn't change him at all.
Actually they did they buffed his shield which has helped him considerably.
you must be one of those teemos I've been hearing about.
Some say Urgot is the opposite of teemo.

I've always been a fan of Urgot. probably in a similar way as I gravitated towards Nasus early in League.  I've always felt he's under rated, and I'm happy he's getting more attention--then again maybe not heh.

I really don't feel he needs a rework, even though RIOT does reworks soo well (Sion comes to mind).  I consider Urgot perhaps the best **bellwether champion** in the game.  He has a lot of elements that work together, debuffing, tanky features, steady damage as opposed to spiky.  So I am of the poinion that the game, in terms of strategy and play-balance, has gelled to a point where a beast like Urgot can thrive as much as any other.  Where team comp and synergy is paramount over simple lane picks.

Bravo RIOT!
Everyone is talking about how they're using their crabgot or battlecast and I'm just laughing with my butcher urgot skin{{summoner:30}}
Haha I have Butcher Urgot on one account and Crabgot on another
I used to play Urgot in the jungle.  It was tons of fun.  Once he has his ult ganking is pretty easy.  Good to see him getting some more attention again.

Urgot is one of the most versatile champs on the rift. As a marksman/fighter he can effectively go adc, top, mid, jungle apparently. And recently I've been trying him as support and it works really well. He's a hard(aggressive) type especially after lvl6. His passive and spell effects + some items,ie. {{item:3110}} {{item:3085}} , work soo well against ad champs. Make him an Urgod skin Rito!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
